verses.text: \add A Psalm\add* of David. To thee, O LORD, do I lift up my soul.
O my God, I trust in thee: let me not be ashamed, let not my enemies triumph over me,
Also, let none that wait on thee be ashamed: let them be ashamed who transgress without cause.
Show me thy ways, O LORD; teach me thy paths.
Lead me in thy truth, and teach me: for thou \add art\add* the God of my salvation; on thee do I wait all the day.
Remember, O LORD, thy tender mercies and thy loving kindnesses; for they \add have been\add* ever of old.
Remember not the sins of my youth, nor my transgressions: according to thy mercy remember thou me for thy goodness' sake, O LORD.
Good and upright \add is\add* the LORD: therefore will he teach sinners in the way.
The meek will he guide in judgment: and the meek will he teach his way.
All the paths of the LORD \add are\add* mercy and truth to such as keep his covenant and his testimonies.
For thy name's sake, O LORD, pardon my iniquity; for it \add is\add* great.
What man \add is\add* he that feareth the LORD? him shall he teach in the way \add that\add* he shall choose.
His soul shall dwell at ease; and his seed shall inherit the earth.
The secret of the LORD \add is\add* with them that fear him; and he will show them his covenant.
My eyes \add are\add* ever towards the LORD; for he will pluck my feet out of the net.
Turn thee to me, and have mercy upon me; for I \add am\add* desolate and afflicted.
The troubles of my heart are enlarged: O bring thou me out of my distresses.
Look upon my affliction and my pain; and forgive all my sins.
Consider my enemies, for they are many; and they hate me with cruel hatred.
O keep my soul, and deliver me: let me not be ashamed; for I put my trust in thee.
Let integrity and uprightness preserve me; for I wait on thee.
Redeem Israel, O God, out of all his troubles.
